titles.title: DNA Identification Grants Improvement Act of 1995
DNA Identification Grants Improvement Act of 1995
DNA Identification Grants Improvement Act of 1995
To improve the capability to analyze deoxyribonucleic acid.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 104-393.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 200.

action.text: Mr. McCollum moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays (2/3 required): 407 - 5 (Roll No. 847).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.

term.name: Federal aid to law enforcement agencies

bill.summary: 12/12/1995--Passed House amended. DNA Identification Grants Improvement Act of 1995 - Amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act to authorize FY 1996 through 2000 appropriations for DNA identification grants. Amends the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994 to prohibit the use of certain indexed DNA records to formulate statistical profiles for use in predicting criminal behavior.
